HugsLib.UpdateFeatureDef.content: By request it is now possible to define how large the new layers drilled should be. Default is to inherit the colonys map-size but using the mod-settings this can for example be lowered to cause less of a performance impact.

There is now a low-tech setting in the options. This will change the drill to not use power and not cost any components (but more metal). The drill is then operated by a pawn and uses mining skill to mine. Even in the normal mode the drill can now be used by pawns if its out of power. Manual drilling takes a long time.
When the mode is changed in the mod-options you need to reload the save if you have already built drills for the drills to change.
Transfer items between layers automatically. If there are any storage-buildings built next to the mine-shaft you can now select to automatically transfer items from these to a layer and reverse.

This update adds a highly requested feature, power-transfer between layers. The drill on the top layer will now be able to send a set amount of power, splitted equally between the lower layers. If the drill is not currently drilling it will send 1000W of its 1200W power-demand to the lower layers. There is also possible to set an extra amount that should be sent, changed in 100W steps via gizmos on the drill.

This update adds more vanilla-like icons for the drill-gizmos, made by Ontheheavens. It also adds a new texture for the drill, based on the retexture-mod by sk4p3g04t and reworked by Ontheheavens. The old drill-texture is still used if the low-tech option is enabled in the mod-settings. If the low-tech option is changed any already built drills will now convert to the selected tech-level upon loading a save. The manual drilling is now only possible on the low-tech drill as the new graphic does not really allow manual drilling.
